Game.Name: Bible Adventures (USA) (Unl)
Game.plot: Overview:A Bible Adventures NES game cartridge. Because the game wasn't officially licensed, other means were used to produce copies of the game, including the use of a non-standard plastic shell.Bible Addventures is a 1991 NES game developed and published by Wisdom Tree without licensed authorization from Nintendo. The game was later remade for the Sega Genesis in 1995, again without being officially licensed by Sega. The game was not sold at retail at stores where video game products were normally available, but rather was limited to distribution through Christian bookstores and similar small businesses.Gameplay:The Bible Adventures title screen.Bible Adventures consists of three games based on the Old Testament; Noah's Ark, Baby Moses, and David and Goliath.Noah's ArkIn Noah's Ark, the player takes on the role of Noah. The goal of the game is to run around the environment, pick up animals, and carry them to the ark.Baby MosesBaby Moses is a side-scrolling platformer in which the player takest the role of Miriam. The goal is to carry the baby Moses to the end of each level. It is possible to reach the end of each stage without carrying Moses, but if such is the case, the player is forced to play the stage over again.David and GoliathDavid and Goliath is a side-scrolling platformer which the player takes on the role of a young David.
Game.Notes: Bible Adventures contains three different side scrolling platform games, each with a different bible theme. The first game is Noah's Ark. Here the player needs to search forests, caverns, and mountains to find a male and female of each species and bring them back to the ark before the flood begins. The next game is Save Baby Moses, where the player needs to get past numerous soldiers and other obstacles to bring the baby Moses to safety. The last game is David and Goliath. As the shepherd David, the player needs to round up and protect the family's flock of sheep. After all of the sheep are safe, the player will then need to face Goliath.
